member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.AddOSResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Attaches tags to an existing domain. Tags are a set of case-sensitive key value pairs. An domain can have up to 10 tags. See Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Service domains for more information.

para.para: Specify the ARN of the domain you want to add tags to.
List of Tag to add to the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.AddOSResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.AddTagsResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.AddOSResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the TagList parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^TagList' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.AddOSResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.ApproveOSInboundConnectionCmdlet
member.summary: Allows the remote domain owner to accept an inbound cross-cluster connection request.

para.para: The ID of the inbound connection you want to accept.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.ApproveOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connection'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.AcceptInboundConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.AcceptInboundConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.ApproveOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.ApproveOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.DenyOSInboundConnectionCmdlet
member.summary: Allows the remote domain owner to reject an inbound cross-cluster connection request.

para.para: The ID of the inbound connection to reject.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.DenyOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connection'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.RejectInboundConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.RejectInboundConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.DenyOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.DenyOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSCompatibleVersionCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of upgrade-compatible versions of OpenSearch/Elasticsearch. You can optionally pass a DomainName to get all upgrade-compatible versions of OpenSearch/Elasticsearch for that specific domain.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSCompatibleVersionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'CompatibleVersions'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.GetCompatibleVersionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.GetCompatibleVersionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSCompatibleVersionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DomainName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DomainName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainCmdlet
member.summary: Returns domain configuration information about the specified domain, including the domain ID, domain endpoint, and domain ARN.

para.para: The name of the domain for which you want information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DomainStatus'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeDomainResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeDomainResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DomainName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DomainName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainAutoTuneCmdlet
member.summary:
Provides scheduled Auto-Tune action details for the domain, such as Auto-Tune action type, description, severity, and scheduled date.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The domain name for which you want Auto-Tune action details.
Set this value to limit the number of results returned. If not specified, defaults to 100.
NextToken is sent in case the earlier API call results contain the NextToken. Used for pagination.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainAutoTuneCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AutoTunes'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeDomainAutoTunesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeDomainAutoTunesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainAutoTuneCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DomainName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DomainName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainAutoTuneCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainChangeProgressCmdlet
member.summary: Returns information about the current blue/green deployment happening on a domain, including a change ID, status, and progress stages.

para.para: The specific change ID for which you want to get progress information. This is an optional parameter. If omitted, the service returns information about the most recent configuration change.
The domain you want to get the progress information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSDomainsForPackageListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists all Amazon OpenSearch Service domains associated with the package.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The package for which to list associated domains.
Limits the results to a maximum number of domains.
Used for pagination. Only necessary if a previous API call includes a non-null NextToken value. If provided, returns results for the next page.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSInboundConnectionCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists all the inbound cross-cluster connections for a remote domain.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para:
A list of filters used to match properties for inbound cross-cluster connections. Available Filter values are:
connection-id
local-domain-info.domain-name
local-domain-info.owner-id
local-domain-info.region
remote-domain-info.domain-name
Set this value to limit the number of results returned. If not specified, defaults to 100.
If more results are available and NextToken is present, make the next request to the same API with the received NextToken to paginate the remaining results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connections'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeInboundConnectionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeInboundConnectionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSInboundConnectionCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSOutboundConnectionCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists all the outbound cross-cluster connections for a local domain.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para:
A list of filters used to match properties for outbound cross-cluster connections. Available Filter names for this operation are:
connection-id
remote-domain-info.domain-name
remote-domain-info.owner-id
remote-domain-info.region
local-domain-info.domain-name
Set this value to limit the number of results returned. If not specified, defaults to 100.
NextToken is sent in case the earlier API call results contain the NextToken parameter. Used for pagination.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceListCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns information about reserved OpenSearch instances for this account.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The reserved instance identifier filter value. Use this parameter to show only the reservation that matches the specified reserved OpenSearch instance ID.
Set this value to limit the number of results returned. If not specified, defaults to 100.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceOfferingListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists available reserved OpenSearch instance offerings.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The offering identifier filter value. Use this parameter to show only the available offering that matches the specified reservation identifier.
Set this value to limit the number of results returned. If not specified, defaults to 100.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceOfferingListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ReservedInstanceOfferings'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeReservedInstanceOfferingsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.DescribeReservedInstanceOfferingsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceOfferingListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ReservedInstanceOfferingId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ReservedInstanceOfferingId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSReservedInstanceOfferingListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Returns all tags for the given domain.

para.para: Specify the ARN of the domain that the tags you want to view are attached to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'TagList'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.ListTagsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.ListTagsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ARN parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ARN' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSUpgradeHistoryCmdlet
member.summary:
Retrieves the complete history of the last 10 upgrades performed on the domain.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.GetOSVersionListCmdlet
member.summary:
List all supported versions of OpenSearch and Elasticsearch.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: Set this value to limit the number of results returned. Value must be greater than 10 or it won't be honored.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Versions'. member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.NewOSDomainCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Service domains in the Amazon OpenSearch Service Developer Guide.

para.para: IAM access policy as a JSON-formatted string.

Option to allow references to indices in an HTTP request body. Must be false when configuring access to individual sub-resources. By default, the value is true. See Advanced cluster parameters for more information.
True if Anonymous auth is enabled. Anonymous auth can be enabled only when AdvancedSecurity is enabled on existing domains.
The time, in UTC format, when the service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.
An integer value to indicate the number of availability zones for a domain when zone awareness is enabled. This should be equal to number of subnets if VPC endpoints is enabled.
The fully qualified domain for your custom endpoint.
The ACM certificate ARN for your custom endpoint.
Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain.
Total number of dedicated master nodes, active and on standby, for the cluster.
A boolean value to indicate whether a dedicated master node is enabled. See Dedicated master nodes in Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.
The instance type for a dedicated master node.
The Auto-Tune desired state. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

The name of the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain you're creating. Domain names are unique across the domains owned by an account within an AWS region. Domain names must start with a lowercase letter and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and - (hyphen).
Whether EBS-based storage is enabled.
True if advanced security is enabled.
True if SAML is enabled.
Enable cold storage option. Accepted values true or false
The option to enable Cognito for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
The option to enable encryption at rest.
True to enable node-to-node encryption.
Whether only HTTPS endpoint should be enabled for the domain.

String of format Elasticsearch_X.Y or OpenSearch_X.Y to specify the engine version for the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. For example, "OpenSearch_1.0" or "Elasticsearch_7.9". For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Service domains .
The unique entity ID of the application in SAML identity provider.
The Cognito identity pool ID for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
The number of instances in the specified domain cluster.
The instance type for an OpenSearch cluster. UltraWarm instance types are not supported for data instances.
True if the internal user database is enabled.
The IOPS for Provisioned IOPS And GP3 EBS volume (SSD).
The KMS key ID for encryption at rest options.
Map of LogType and LogPublishingOption, each containing options to publish a given type of OpenSearch log.
A list of maintenance schedules. See Auto-Tune for Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.
The backend role that the SAML master user is mapped to.
ARN for the master user (if IAM is enabled).
The master user's username, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The SAML master username, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The master user's password, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The metadata of the SAML application in XML format.
The role ARN that provides OpenSearch permissions for accessing Cognito resources.
Element of the SAML assertion to use for backend roles. Default is roles.
The security groups for the VPC endpoint.
The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive. Acceptable values are between 1 and 1440, and the default value is 60.
Element of the SAML assertion to use for username. Default is NameID.
The subnets for the VPC endpoint.
A list of Tag added during domain creation.
The Throughput for GP3 EBS volume (SSD).

Specify the TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the domain.
Can be one of the following values:
Policy-Min-TLS-1-0-2019-07: TLS security policy which supports TLSv1.0 and higher.
Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07: TLS security policy which supports only TLSv1.2
The Cognito user pool ID for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
Integer to specify the size of an EBS volume.
The volume type for EBS-based storage.
The number of UltraWarm nodes in the cluster.
True to enable UltraWarm storage.
The instance type for the OpenSearch cluster's warm nodes.
A boolean value to indicate whether zone awareness is enabled. See Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.NewOSDomainCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DomainStatus'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.CreateDomainResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.CreateDomainResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.NewOSDomainCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.StopOSServiceSoftwareUpdateCmdlet
member.summary: Cancels a scheduled service software update for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. You can only perform this operation before the AutomatedUpdateDate and when the UpdateStatus is in the PENDING_UPDATE state.

para.para: The name of the domain that you want to stop the latest service software update on.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DomainName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DomainName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.StopOSServiceSoftwareUpdateCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainCmdlet
member.summary: Allows you to either upgrade your domain or perform an upgrade eligibility check to a compatible version of OpenSearch or Elasticsearch.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: When true, indicates that an upgrade eligibility check needs to be performed. Does not actually perform the upgrade.
The version of OpenSearch you intend to upgrade the domain to.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpgradeDomainResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpgradeDomainResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the TargetVersion parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^TargetVersion' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainConfigCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the cluster configuration of the specified domain, such as setting the instance type and the number of instances.

para.para: IAM access policy as a JSON-formatted string.

Modifies the advanced option to allow references to indices in an HTTP request body. Must be false when configuring access to individual sub-resources. By default, the value is true. See Advanced options for more information.
True if Anonymous auth is enabled. Anonymous auth can be enabled only when AdvancedSecurity is enabled on existing domains.
The time, in UTC format, when the service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.
An integer value to indicate the number of availability zones for a domain when zone awareness is enabled. This should be equal to number of subnets if VPC endpoints is enabled.
The fully qualified domain for your custom endpoint.
The ACM certificate ARN for your custom endpoint.
Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain.
Total number of dedicated master nodes, active and on standby, for the cluster.
A boolean value to indicate whether a dedicated master node is enabled. See Dedicated master nodes in Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.
The instance type for a dedicated master node.
The Auto-Tune desired state. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.
The name of the domain you're updating.
This flag, when set to True, specifies whether the UpdateDomain request should return the results of validation checks (DryRunResults) without actually applying the change.
Whether EBS-based storage is enabled.
True if advanced security is enabled.
True if SAML is enabled.
Enable cold storage option. Accepted values true or false
The option to enable Cognito for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
The option to enable encryption at rest.
True to enable node-to-node encryption.
Whether only HTTPS endpoint should be enabled for the domain.
The unique entity ID of the application in SAML identity provider.
The Cognito identity pool ID for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
The number of instances in the specified domain cluster.
The instance type for an OpenSearch cluster. UltraWarm instance types are not supported for data instances.
True if the internal user database is enabled.
The IOPS for Provisioned IOPS And GP3 EBS volume (SSD).
The KMS key ID for encryption at rest options.
Map of LogType and LogPublishingOption, each containing options to publish a given type of OpenSearch log.
A list of maintenance schedules. See Auto-Tune for Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.
The backend role that the SAML master user is mapped to.
ARN for the master user (if IAM is enabled).
The master user's username, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The SAML master username, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The master user's password, which is stored in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's internal database.
The metadata of the SAML application in XML format.
The role ARN that provides OpenSearch permissions for accessing Cognito resources.
Element of the SAML assertion to use for backend roles. Default is roles.
The rollback state while disabling Auto-Tune for the domain. Valid values are NO_ROLLBACK and DEFAULT_ROLLBACK.
The security groups for the VPC endpoint.
The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive. Acceptable values are between 1 and 1440, and the default value is 60.
Element of the SAML assertion to use for username. Default is NameID.
The subnets for the VPC endpoint.
The Throughput for GP3 EBS volume (SSD).

Specify the TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the domain.
Can be one of the following values:
Policy-Min-TLS-1-0-2019-07: TLS security policy which supports TLSv1.0 and higher.
Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07: TLS security policy which supports only TLSv1.2
The Cognito user pool ID for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.
Integer to specify the size of an EBS volume.
The volume type for EBS-based storage.
The number of UltraWarm nodes in the cluster.
True to enable UltraWarm storage.
The instance type for the OpenSearch cluster's warm nodes.
A boolean value to indicate whether zone awareness is enabled. See Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service for more information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainConfigCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DomainConfig'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpdateDomainConfigResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpdateDomainConfigResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSDomainConfigCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSPackageCmdlet
member.summary: Updates a package for use with Amazon OpenSearch Service domains.

para.para: A commit message for the new version which is shown as part of GetPackageVersionHistoryResponse.
A new description of the package.
The unique identifier for the package.
The name of the Amazon S3 bucket containing the package.
Key (file name) of the package.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSPackageCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'PackageDetails'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpdatePackageResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.OpenSearchService.Model.UpdatePackageResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSPackageCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the PackageID parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^PackageID' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OS.UpdateOSPackageCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
